required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ketoprofen With or Without Vaginal Isonicotinic Acid Hydrazide Prior to Hysterosalpingography
clinical_study.official_title: Ketoprofen With or Without Vaginal Isonicotinic Acid Hydrazide (INH) Prior to Hysterosalpingography in Primarily Infertile Patients: a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of our study is to determine the efficacy of Ketoprofen with or without vaginal isonicotinic acid hydrazide on the pain scores during HSG.

detailed_description.textblock: hysterosalpingography can cause pain and discomfort in several ways: Use of the tenaculum to grasp the cervix and straighten the uterus for proper insertion; trans-cervical actions including measuring uterine depth, inserting the cannula; and injection of the dye

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: double blind placebo randomized controlled trial
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: double blind placebo randomized controlled trial

primary_outcome.description: pain during the procedure assessed by the visual analog scale from 0=no pain to 10 = the worst pain imaginable

secondary_outcome.description: Pain intensity will be assessed by visual analogue scale 30 minutes after the procedure.visual analogue scale ranging from 0 to 10

arm_group.description: patients will have of oral Ketoprofen 60 minutes before the procedure plus 3 table 900 mg vaginal isonicotinic acid hydrazide by the patient 12 hours before the procedure
patients will have of oral Ketoprofen 60 minutes before the procedure plus 3 table vaginal placebo by the patient 12 hours before the procedure

intervention.description: patients will have of oral Ketoprofen 60 minutes before the procedure plus 3 table 900 mg vaginal isonicotinic acid hydrazide by the patient 12 hours before the procedure
patients will have of oral Ketoprofen 60 minutes before the procedure plus 3 table placebo by the patient 12 hours before the procedure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- any patient came for Hysterosalpingography
Exclusion Criteria:
- any patient has contraindication to HSG

eligibility.gender_description: female candidate for 30 minutes after the procedure
